page.title: 14EDUCATION IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The Village School is a Church Aided School, and it is l25 years old. The building had slowly been deteriorating , and in l984 was under threat of closure. After public meetings and pressure being put upon the Authorities, it was resolved that the school roof would be replaced, and repairs would be made to the Classrooms if the parents would undertake to raise Â£1,000. This they managed in a matter of months through a variety of fund raising events and donations. The most lucrative fund-raiser was a Calendar of Trelawnyd Past and Present, and a book on Trelawnyd which was arranged by a former pupil of the school. The school has 2.5 teachers and 53 pupils from Llanasa, Axton and Trelawnyd.The children receive regular visits from the clergy,and support the Church.
